intro: Erigeron oreophilus var. dactyloides, commonly known as the mountain blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture. Its flowers are blue to purple in color and bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is noted for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions and its role in stabilizing soil in arid regions.
